column1: Treptow-Köpenick (pronounced [ˈtʁeːpto ˈkøːpənɪk]) is the ninth borough of Berlin
column3: formed in Berlin's 2001 administrative reform by merging the former boroughs of Treptow and Köpenick.

column1: Among Berlin's boroughs it is the largest by area with the lowest population density. The Johannisthal Air Field
column4: between Johannisthal and Adlershof.  Treptower Park
column5: a popular place for recreation and a tourist destination
column6: is also located in the borough.  The park features the sprawling Soviet War Memorial
column7: a war memorial to the Soviet soldiers who fell in the Battle of Berlin in 1945.
